verses.verse: Then Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> answered,<WH6030>
"Should a wise man<WH2450> answer<WH6030> with vain<WH7307> knowledge,<WH1847> and fill<WH4390> himself<WH990> with the east wind?<WH6921>
Should he reason<WH3198> with unprofitable<WH5532> talk,<WH1697> or with speeches<WH4405> with which he can do no good?<WH3276>
Yes,<WH6565> you do away with fear,<WH3374> and hinder<WH1639> devotion<WH7881> before<WH6440> God.<WH410>
For your iniquity<WH5771> teaches<WH502> your mouth,<WH6310> and you choose<WH977> the language<WH3956> of the crafty.<WH6175>
Your own mouth<WH6310> condemns<WH7561> you,<WH8193> and not I. Yes, your own lips testify against you.<WH6030>
"Are you the first<WH7223> man<WH120> who was born?<WH3205> Or were you brought<WH2342> forth before<WH6440> the hills?<WH1389>
Have you heard<WH8085> the secret<WH5475> counsel of God?<WH433> Do you limit<WH1639> wisdom to yourself?<WH2451>
What do you know,<WH3045> that we don't<WH3045> know? What do you understand,<WH995> which is not in us?
With us are both the gray-headed<WH7867> and the very aged<WH3453> men,<WH3524> much elder<WH3117> than your father.<WH1>
Are the consolations<WH8575> of God<WH410> too small<WH4592> for you,<WH1697> even the word that is gentle toward you?<WH328>
Why does your heart<WH3820> carry you away?<WH3947> Why do your eyes<WH5869> flash,<WH7335>
That you turn<WH7725> your spirit<WH7307> against God,<WH410> and let such words<WH4405> go out<WH3318> of your mouth?<WH6310>
What is man,<WH582> that he should be clean?<WH2135> What is he who is born<WH3205> of a woman,<WH802> that he should be righteous?<WH6663>
Behold,<WH539> he puts no trust in his holy<WH6918> ones.<WH8064> Yes, the heavens are not clean<WH2141> in his sight;<WH5869>
how much less one<WH376> who is abominable<WH8581> and corrupt,<WH376> a man who drinks<WH8354> iniquity<WH5766> like water!<WH4325>
"I will show<WH2331> you,<WH8085> listen to me;<WH2372> that which I have seen I will declare:<WH5608>
(Which wise<WH2450> men have told<WH5046> by their fathers,<WH1> and have not hidden it;<WH3582>
to whom alone the land<WH776> was given,<WH5414> and no stranger<WH2114> passed<WH5674> among them<WH8432>):
the wicked<WH7563> man writhes<WH2342> in pain all his days,<WH3117> even the number<WH4557> of years<WH8141> that are laid<WH6845> up for the oppressor.<WH6184>
A sound<WH6963> of terrors<WH6343> is in his ears.<WH241> In prosperity<WH7965> the destroyer<WH7703> shall come on him.<WH935>
He doesn't<WH539> believe that he shall return<WH7725> out of darkness.<WH2822> He is waited<WH6822> for by the sword.<WH2719>
He wanders abroad<WH5074> for bread,<WH3899> saying,<WH3045> 'Where is it?' He knows that the day<WH3117> of darkness<WH2822> is ready<WH3559> at his hand.<WH3027>
Distress<WH6862> and anguish<WH4691> make him afraid.<WH1204> They prevail<WH8630> against him,<WH4428> as a king ready<WH6264> to the battle.<WH3593>
Because he has stretched out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> against God,<WH410> and behaves himself proudly<WH1396> against the Almighty;<WH7706>
he runs<WH7323> at him with a stiff neck,<WH6677> with the thick<WH5672> shields<WH1354> of his bucklers;<WH4043>
because he has covered<WH3680> his face<WH6440> with his fatness,<WH2459> and gathered<WH6213> fat<WH6371> on his thighs.<WH3689>
He has lived<WH7931> in desolate<WH3582> cities,<WH5892> in houses<WH1004> which no one inhabited,<WH3427> which were ready<WH6257> to become heaps.<WH1530>
He shall not be rich,<WH6238> neither shall his substance<WH2428> continue,<WH6965> neither shall their possessions<WH5186> be extended<WH4512> on the earth.<WH776>
He shall not depart<WH5493> out of darkness.<WH2822> The flame<WH7957> shall dry up<WH3001> his branches.<WH3127> By the breath<WH7307> of God<WH6310>'s mouth shall he go away.<WH5493>
Let him not trust<WH539> in emptiness,<WH7723> deceiving<WH8582> himself;<WH7723> for emptiness shall be his reward.<WH8545>
It shall be accomplished<WH4390> before<WH3808> his time.<WH3117> His branch<WH3712> shall not be green.<WH7488>
He shall shake off<WH2554> his unripe grape<WH1154> as the vine,<WH1612> and shall cast off<WH7993> his flower<WH5328> as the olive tree.<WH2132>
For the company<WH5712> of the godless<WH2611> shall be barren,<WH1565> and fire<WH784> shall consume<WH398> the tents<WH168> of bribery.<WH7810>
They conceive<WH2029> mischief,<WH5999> and bring forth<WH3205> iniquity.<WH205> Their heart<WH990> prepares<WH3559> deceit.<WH4820>"
